intro: Amparoa cervantesii subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western amparoa, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the mountainous regions of western Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded, humid environments. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other members of the Amparoa genus. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
